page.title: 13Buildings:Gillamoor,Hutton.
page.content: This area contains two very attractive villages,Gillamoor and Hutton-le-Hole. The latter, designated a conservation area,consists of traditional stone and pantile cottages,built according to the geological structure of the common and stream.Individual houses are not distinctive though several are"listed" eg.'Hammer and Hand'1784.The pinfold stands complete but unused.Gillamoor, again built of stone and pantiles is arranged in a T-shape on wide roads with pretty gardens and farmyards. The properties of both villages are mostly owner-occupied.Of some 40 Houses in Gillamoor,11 are holiday cottages,5 are council houses and 3 are newly built.Of the 75 or so houses in Hutton,17 are holiday homes, 3 are council houses and one is new. In the last three years, 20 houses have changed ownership.
